name: Lluch Standard Homologation Template
description: Complete homologation questionnaire template based on real Lluch format. Includes 174 fields covering supplier info, certifications, compliance, allergens, quality parameters, and sustainability.

Recommended shelf life (days)
questions.defaultValue: According to the expiration date on the CoA

questions.fieldName: Recommended storage temperature (ºC)
Recommended transport temperature (ºC)
Special storage conditions
questions.defaultValue: Store product in full, tightly closed container

questions.fieldName: The supplier hereby guarantee that, as of the date of shipment or delivery, the articles comprising each shipment of delivery hereafter are on such date not adulterated or misbranded within the meaning of Federal Food, Drug & Cosmetics Act as amended; the Food Additives Amendment  (together, the “FD&C Act”)or (2) not an article which may not under the provisions of Sections 404 or 505 said Act, as amended, be introduced into interstate commerce and not adulterated  or  misbranded  within  the  meaning of the  food laws  or ordinance (then in effect) of the state or city to which such  articles are shipped, the provisions of which are identical or substantially the same as those found in the Federal Food and Drug & Cosmetic Act. That the food products, ingredients and components are of merchantable quality, fit for the ordinary purposes for which such food products are normally used and wholesome and fit for human consumption. Non-Irradiated/No-Sludge Guarantee 7 CFR 205.105  are not grown or handled with the use of sewer sludge and ionizing radiation, as described in Food and Drug Administration regulation, 21 CFR 179.26 . Lot Code have been assigned a unique lot code to ensure complete traceability down to each raw material and packaging material used. BSE / TSE are NOT of animal origin. Furthermore, as a FDA (Food and Drug Administration) regulated facility, and in accordance with the FDA proposed rules and approved guidelines, we have taken appropriate steps to minimize the risk of contamination of our products with Bovine Spongiform Encephalopathy (BSE) or Transmissible Spongiform Encephalopathy (TSE).  Animal By-Products, Human-Derived Products, BPA, Melamine are free of animal by-products, human-derived products, BPA, or Melamine. Our products have not been tested on animals. 1.13 Food Contact Packaging Safely NOP 7 CFR 205.272(b)(1)  have not been allowed to come in contact with synthetic fungicide, preservative, or fumigant. All food contact packaging materials are free of prohibited synthetic fungicide, preservative, or fumigant. 1.14 Heavy Metals, California Toxics in Packaging Prevention Act (AB2021), and Ethical Standards / California Transparency in Supply Chains Act of 2010 and applicable US Federal regulations were produced without the use of forced labor such as child labor, slavery, prison labor. We strive to comply with all applicable laws and regulations regarding employment, occupational health and safety, and immigration. Our suppliers are also required to meet our ethical standards.
Is the product registered under REACH EU?
REACH EU Exemption
REACH EU volume tonnage band

Does the product contains any substance included in the Authorisation List (Annex XIV of REACH)
Does the product contains any substance subject to Restriction as per Annex XVII of REACH? If so, please indicate: https://echa.europa.eu/es/substances-restricted-under-reach
Is the product subject to IFRA restrictions or prohibitions (Last amendment)? If yes, please indicate:
Is the product in compliance with the Cosmetics Regulation (EU) N° 1223/2009 in its latest version in force?

Does the product contain any ingredients listed in Annex II (prohibited materials), Annex III (restricted substances), Annex IV (colours), Annex V (preservatives) and/or Annex VI (UV filters) of the Cosmetics Regulation (EU) N° 1223/2009? For the substances considered as fragrance allergens (Cosmetic Regulation (EC) No 1223/2009, Annex III, No. 67-92) please complete the separate table.

Does the product contain any allergen ingredient listed according to Regulation 1223/2009 relating to Cosmetic products, and further amendments? If yes, please indicate the maximum content present in your product.

questions.fieldName: Does the product contain any ingredient from animal origin?
Could you confirm there is no substance from animal origin in the premises where the product is manufactured?
Could you confirm neither the product nor its starting materials are obtained by fermentation or with the aid of enzymes, bacteria or yeasts?
Does the final product contain ethanol? If so, please, specify its content.
Could you confirm none of its raw materials is obtained from ethanol?

Is ethanol used as a cleaning agent? In the cleaning process of equipment and tools ethanol can be used, among other cleaning agents, and just a small technical residual quantity (maximum 0.005%) might remain.
Is the product in compliance with HALAL guidelines?

Following Lluch Essence Renewable ingredients definition, is the product partly or fully derived from biological material (animal, plant, others) including chemicals derived from biological material e.g. pine, palm, rapeseed oil, clove etc.?
If so, please advise the botanical origin.
If so, please advise the percentage of renewability.
Does the biological material originate from cultivation, wild collection or biotechnology?
Is the product 100% derived from non-renewable sources i.e. petrochemicals or inorganics?
Is the product fully compliant with 2023/1115/EC?
Is your product derived using reaction chemistry?
Do you use a catalyst?

Is the product included on the Nagoya Protocol? Detail information with respect Nagoya Protocol on Access to Genetic Resources and the Fair and Equitable Sharing of Benefits Arising from their Utilization (ABS) to the Convention on Biological Diversity. https://www.cbd.int/abs/about/default.shtml

Is the product regulated by CITES? Detail information with respect to Regulation (EC) 338/97 (CITES) as amended concerning the protection of species of wild fauna and flora. http://checklist.cites.org/#/en
Does the manufacturing of the product involve one of the following processes?
What quantity of energy is consumed to generate 1 kg of product (Mw/Ton)?
Is there any renewable energy production implemented in your facilities? (solar panels, hydropower, windmills…)
If so, please specify the type and amount (%) of renewable energy produced (solar panels, hydropower, windmills…)
What amount of renewable energy (%) is consumed to generate 1kg of product (Mw/Ton)?
What amount of water is consumed to generate 1 Kg of product (m3/Ton)?
Do you perform the product carbon footprint calculations?
Do you perform the product carbon footprint offseting?
Provide the Kg of CO2eq emitted to produce 1 Kg of product
Is there a transportation of raw material from collection/harvest to process?
If there is a transportation, how many km are between collection / harvest to the processing site? (Km)
Do you perform the calculation and offsetting of the transport carbon footprint?
How many Kg of Biomass or extract is produced per hectare of land? (Kg/ha)
Are inputs used to produce the product (such as nitrogen, pesticides…)?
What is the E-factor of this material?
What is the product reciclability?
If applicable, provide the composition in recycled raw materials
